sentences.english: The spoilt child sat there pouting.
sentences.chinese: 那個嬌慣壞了的孩子坐在那裏撅嘴。

sentences.english: She coddles him like a child.
sentences.chinese: 她像對待小孩子那樣嬌慣他。

sentences.english: This is because when the mother is too coddle the beginning child.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲當媽媽的一開始就太嬌慣寶寶了。

sentences.english: I am just a pampered Western wuss.
sentences.chinese: 我只是個被嬌慣壞了的西方人，一個沒有主見的人。

sentences.english: But China’s out-of-work peasants may not be ready to pamper themselves.
sentences.chinese: 但是中國失業的農民可能沒準備好嬌慣自己。

sentences.english: His mother might turn him into a mollycoddle.
sentences.chinese: 他母親可能會把他嬌慣成個懦夫。

sentences.english: The book takes Beijing to task not only for coddling the Americans but also for neglecting national defense.
sentences.chinese: 該書責備北京嬌慣美國人，忽視國防。

sentences.english: As a child, he had been spoiled and cosseted.
Grown boys and girls must not be mollycoddled any more.
sentences.chinese: 長大了的孩子不可再嬌慣。

sentences.english: Don’t play “pregnant princess, ” and expect people to wait on you.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲懷孕嬌慣自己，期待他人伺候你。
